document.docTitle: Mediolata obtecta Dönel & Doğan 2012, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new mite species of the genus Mediolata Canestrini (Acari, Stigmaeidae) from Turkey and re-description of Mediolata granaria Gonzalez-Rodriguez

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new mite species of the genus Mediolata Canestrini (Acari, Stigmaeidae) from Turkey and re-description of Mediolata granaria Gonzalez-Rodriguez

caption.paragraph:
Figure 11.
Mediolata obtecta
sp. nov. , female – (A) Dorsal view of idiosoma; (B) ventral view of idiosoma.

subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype female and two paratype females and two males from litter on forest floor, 40 ◦ 15 ′ 46 ′′ N, 38 ◦ 50 ′ 18 ′′ E, 1820 m , Alucra, 22 October 2007 .

caption.paragraph:
Figure 12.
Mediolata obtecta
sp. nov. , female – (A) Gnathosoma ; (B) palp.

Figure 13.
Mediolata obtecta
sp. nov. , female – (A) Leg I; (B) leg II; (C) leg III; (D) leg IV.

subSubSection.paragraph: Venter . Coxisternal shields absent. Venter completely covered with striae. Ventral podosoma with three pairs of setae ( 1a , 3a and 4a ). Aggenital area with three pairs of aggenital setae ( ag 1–3 ). Anogenital shields with one pair of genital setae ( g 1 ) and three pairs of pseudanal setae ( ps 1–3 )
Legs . Leg I 168 (140–185); leg II 138 (120–158); leg III 125 (107–140); leg IV 150 (143–170). Counts of setae on leg segments as follows (solenidia in parenthesis): coxae

caption.paragraph:
Figure 14.
Mediolata obtecta
sp. nov. , male – (A) Dorsal view of idiosoma; (B) ventral view of idiosoma.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gnathosoma
. With two pairs of adoral setae ( ro 1,2 ) distally, one pair of subcapitular setae ( m ) proximally. Length of subcapitular setae: m 20 (18–23); distance between the setae: m–m 22 (20–24). Chelicera 83 (70–90). Palp 91 (80–100), five–segmented, setal formula (from trochanters to tarsi): 0–2–2–3+1 claw–7 (including solenidion and eupathidium), eupathidium trifid distally.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 15.
Mediolata obtecta
sp. nov. , male – (A) Leg I; (B) leg II; (C) leg III; (D) leg IV.

subSubSection.paragraph: Venter . As in female, but aggenital area with two pairs of aggenital setae. Anogenital shields with three pairs of pseudanal setae, setae ps 1 and ps 2 short and finger-shaped, setae ps 3 more slender and longer than others. Aedeagus evident.

Gnathosoma
. Palp (90–110) and chelicera (55–80). Length of subcapitular setae: m (18–20); distance between the setae: m–m (18–24). Palp chaetotaxy as in female.

The epithet
obtecta
derives from the Latin obtegere (to cover up), alluding to the dorsum being completely covered with reticulate patterns.

The new species resembles
Mediolata pini (Canestrini)
in having two setae on palp femur, genu I with two setae and aggenital shield bearing three pairs of setae. However, it can be distinguished from the latter by dorsal shields fused except the suranal shield, and dorsum differently ornamented. This species further resembles
Mediolata oleariae Wood, 1971
in general appearance; however, it can be distinguished from the latter by trochanter IV with one seta (lacking in
M. oleariae
), setal formula of femora: 4–4–2–1 (5–4–3– 1 in
M. oleariae
), and setal formula of genua: 1+1 Κ –1–1–1 (3+1 Κ –3–1– 1 in
M. oleariae
).
